sen.j: 稲葉 正知（いなば まさとも、貞享2年（1685年） - 享保14年5月29日 (旧暦)（1729年6月25日））は、下総国佐倉藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Masatomo INABA (1685 - June 25, 1729) was the second lord of Sakura Domain of the Shimosa Province.
Masatomo INABA (1685 - June 25, 1729) was the second lord of Sakura Domain of the Shimosa Province.
Masatomo INABA (1685 - June 25, 1729) was the second lord of Sakura Domain of the Shimosa Province.

sen.j: 山城国淀藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: He was the first lord of Yodo domain of the Yamashiro Province.
He was the first lord of Yodo Domain of the Yamashiro Province.
sen.cmt: Domain 大文字にしました。
sen.e: He was the first lord of Yodo Domain of the Yamashiro Province.
He was the fifth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari
He was the fifth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari
He was the fifth grand master of the Inaba family with ties to Masanari

sen.j: 佐倉藩初代藩主・稲葉正往の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of the first lord of Sakura domain Masayuki INABA.
He was the second son of the first lord of Sakura Domain Masayuki INABA.
sen.cmt: Domain 大文字にしました。
sen.e: He was the second son of the first lord of Sakura Domain Masayuki INABA.

sen.j: 正室は小笠原忠雄の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadataka OGASAWARA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadataka OGASAWARA.
His lawful wife was the daughter of Tadataka OGASAWARA.
His second wife was the daughter of the Imamura clan.
His second wife was the daughter of the Imamura clan.
His second wife was the daughter of the Imamura clan.

sen.j: 子に稲葉正貞（長男）、稲葉正任（三男）、稲葉正房（四男）、娘（有馬孝純正室）など。
sen.e: His children included Masasada INABA (first son), Masato INABA (third son), Masafusa INABA (fourth son), and a daughter (lawful wife of Takasumi ARIMA).
His children included Masasada INABA (first son), Masato INABA (third son), Masafusa INABA (fourth son), and a daughter (lawful wife of Takasumi ARIMA).
His children included Masasada INABA (first son), Masato INABA (third son), Masafusa INABA (fourth son), and a daughter (lawful wife of Takasumi ARIMA).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、従四位下、美濃国守、丹後国守、長門国守。
sen.e: His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (the governor of Mino Province), Tango no kuni no kami, and Nagato no kuni no kami.

His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (the governor of Mino Province), Tango no kuni no kami, and Nagato no kuni no kami.

His ranks were Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Mino no kuni no kami (the governor of Mino Province), Tango no kuni no kami, and Nagato no kuni no kami.

sen.j: 貞享2年（1685年）、京都で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Kyoto in 1685.
He was born in Kyoto in 1685.
He was born in Kyoto in 1685.
His childhood name was Uemon.
His childhood name was Uemon.
His childhood name was Uemon.

sen.j: 長兄が早世したために世子となり、宝永4年（1707年）8月21日に佐倉藩主となった。
sen.e: Because his eldest brother died young, he became the heir and became the lord of Sakura Domain in September 16, 1707.
Because his eldest brother died young, he became the heir and became the lord of Sakura Domain in September 16, 1707.
Because his eldest brother died young, he became the heir and became the lord of Sakura Domain in September 16, 1707.

sen.j: このとき、弟の稲葉正佐に3000石を分与している。
sen.e: At this time he distributed 3000 koku to his younger brother Masasuke INABA.
At this time he distributed 3000 koku to his younger brother Masasuke INABA.
At this time he distributed 3000 koku to his younger brother Masasuke INABA.

sen.j: 佐倉藩の藩政では交通路の整備などに尽力した。
sen.e: During his duties in Sakura Domain, he made efforts to improve traffic routes etc.
During his duties in Sakura Domain, he made efforts to improve traffic routes etc.
During his duties in Sakura Domain, he made efforts to improve traffic routes etc.

sen.j: 享保8年（1723年）5月1日、山城淀藩に移封となる。
sen.e: On June 3, 1723, he was transferred to Yamashiro-Yodo Domain.
On June 3, 1723, he was transferred to Yamashiro-Yodo Domain.
On June 3, 1723, he was transferred to Yamashiro-Yodo Domain.

sen.j: 享保14年（1729年）5月29日、45歳で死去し、後を三男の正任が継いだ。
sen.e: On June 25, 1729, he died at age 45 and his third son Masato succeeded him.
On June 25, 1729, he died at age 45 and his third son Masato succeeded him.
On June 25, 1729, he died at age 45 and his third son Masato succeeded him.
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Banshoin
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Banshoin
Hogo (a Buddhist name): Banshoin

sen.j: 墓所：東京都文京区千駄木の養源寺。
sen.e: Grave: Yogen-ji Temple in Sendagi, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo.
Grave: Yogen-ji Temple in Sendagi, Bunkyo Ward, Tokyo.
